Process.Name: 9.2 Estimate Activity Resources
Process.Objective: This process identifies the key resources required to complete the project, estimating the type, quantity, and characteristics of the materials, equipment and supplies necessary. It can be performed periodically through the lifespan of the project.

Activity.Text: Identify resource needs from the activity list and attributes

Task.Text: Use the Activity List to identify activities with resource requirements
Use the Activity Attributes to define the resource requirements, imposed dates, activity location, assumptions, and constraints
Use the Resource Management Plan to understand the methods used to quantify the|~|resources needed for each activity.
Consider any resource calendars that specify when, and for how long, identified team and physical resources will be available during the project

Activity.Text: Determine the estimation approach to be used

Task.Text: Activity resources can be estimated in various ways. Consider the approach to be used for the project, such as:|~|- Bottom up estimating|~|- Analogous estimating|~|- Parametric estimating|~|- Data analysis (such as alternatives analysis)
Project Management Information Systems can provide estimation and resource management tools or information, depending on their level of sophistication
Define the resource requirements used, and the types and quantities of resources required for each work package or activity

Provide a clear outline of how the resource estimates are derived. Include supporting information such as:|~|- The method used to develop the estimate|~|- The source of information used to develop the estimate (such as information from previous similar projects)|~|- Any assumptions made|~|- Any known constraints|~|- The range of the estimates|~|- The confidence level of the estimate|~|- Any risks influencing the estimate
Develop a resource breakdown structure.|~|This is a hierarchical representation of resources by category and type used to acquire and monitor resources.
